page.title: 09The Local Sub-Post Office.
page.content: The small sub-post office provides the only shop within a two mile radius. Every family in the village will have some cause to visit a least once a week to obtain the family allowance or collect ones old age pension. Two collections of post are obtained he counter each day. That in the morning being taken to Normacot in the Potteries, that in the afternoon to Cheadle. Collection and delivery is by van, for the area covered is large, with many small farms. Delivery on foot would take too long. The post office is run by Mr.& Mrs Dale, a family that have lived in the the village for many years. Mr. Dales father ran the P.O. in 1914. Many years ago on entering the shop you could purchase your grociers too, but now you would have to visit Hanley or Cheadle. Half day closing is Thusday.
